intro: Hirtella cowanii, commonly known as the cowanii hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptic leaves that are covered in fine, short hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. It produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Hirtella cowanii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
